result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:26 PM . Defendant Kent Randolph Hessing in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Kent Randolph Hessing.  Matter will be recalled. The state's witness is running late.

3:51 PM Cross exam by Atty Bergner.
No further questions or witnesses.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Initial Appearance set for June 27, 2022 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 2

1:00 PM Defendant Kent R Hessing in court, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears for the defendant in court.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 7th. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule states objections as to bond request a signature bond or a reduced cash bond.
Court sets bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license and be absolutely sober.
